data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Draco Meteor
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your opponent's Pokémon. If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Deoxys Normal Forme
data.flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Normal Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Normal Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys Normal Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Froslass
data.flavorText: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to Froslass. During your opponent's next turn, if Froslass would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Icy Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Gliscor
data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

attacks.name: Burning Poison
attacks.text: Choose either Burned or Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. You may return Gliscor and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Giratina
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.

attacks.name: Shadow Force
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Giratina during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Brutal Edge
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Heatran
data.flavorText: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Fire Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Heatran. This power can't be used if Heatran is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Magma Storm
attacks.text: You may discard as many basic Energy cards as you like attached to Heatran. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.

abilities.name: Rivalry
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon LV.X in play, each of Luxray's attacks does 50 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Luxray.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxray.

data.name: Kingdra
data.flavorText: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

attacks.name: Aqua Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for as many Water Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and this attack does 10 damage for each Water Energy card you chose. Put those cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dragon Pump
attacks.text: You may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Metagross
data.flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

abilities.name: Magnetic Reversal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Extra Comet Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, Metagross's Extra Comet Punch attack's base damage is 100.

data.name: Mamoswine
data.flavorText: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

attacks.name: Ice Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Charge Through
attacks.text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage and 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If you do, Mamoswine does 40 damage to itself.

data.name: Mewtwo
data.flavorText: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Rayquaza
data.flavorText: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

abilities.name: Speed Gain
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Fire Energy card or a basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza. This power can't be used if Rayquaza is affected by a Special Condition or if you have another Rayquaza in play.

attacks.name: Sky Judgement
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Rayquaza.

data.name: Politoed
data.flavorText: It gathers groups of others as their leader. Its cries make Poliwag obey.

abilities.name: Enthusiasm
abilities.text: If you have Poliwag, Poliwhirl, and Poliwrath in play, each of these Pokémon's attacks does 60 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Probopass
data.flavorText: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units call Mini-Noses.

abilities.name: Steel Coating
abilities.text: Any damage done to Probopass by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 for each Metal Energy attached to Probopass (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't reduce more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Metal Bomber
attacks.text: Choose a number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon up to the amount of Metal Energy attached to Probopass. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

abilities.name: Curse Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Spiritomb from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on all Pokémon that already have any damage counters on them (both yours and your opponent's). You can't use more than 1 Curse Breath Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Transfer Pain
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Armaldo
data.flavorText: It went ashore after evolving. Its entire body is clad in a sturdy armor.

abilities.name: Fossil Armor
abilities.text: If Armaldo would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Armaldo if that damage is 60 or less.

attacks.name: Crush Claw
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Regigigas
data.flavorText: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

abilities.name: Slow Start
abilities.text: Regigigas can't attack until your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left.

attacks.name: Crush Grip
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 120.

data.name: Yanmega
data.flavorText: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.

attacks.name: Sonic Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pursue and Turn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Azelf
data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Willpower." It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

abilities.name: Time Walk
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Azelf from your hand onto your Bench, you may look at all of your face-down Prize cards. If you do, you may choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then, choose 1 card in your hand and put it as a Prize card face down.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cradily
data.flavorText: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.

attacks.name: Drain Down
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon would be Knocked Out by this attack, you may remove all damage counters from Cradily.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Delcatty
data.flavorText: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

abilities.name: Attracting Body
abilities.text: If Delcatty is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Delcatty is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Crawdaunt
data.flavorText: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.

attacks.name: Gripthrow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand.

attacks.name: Prop-up Pinchers
attacks.text: If Crawdaunt has a Technical Machine card attached to it, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Bellossom
data.flavorText: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

attacks.name: Parallel Gain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blend Pollen
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Vileplume and each Bellossom you have in play. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Deoxys Attack Forme
data.flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Attack Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Attack Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys Attack Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Psychic Boost
attacks.text: During your next turn, Deoxys's Psychic Boost attack's base damage is 20.

data.name: Deoxys Defense Forme
data.flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Defense Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Defense Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys Defense Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Psychic Defense
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of an attack, and any damage done to Deoxys by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

abilities.name: Ditto DNA
abilities.text: As long as Ditto is your Active Pokémon, its maximum HP is the same as your opponent's Active Pokémon. Ditto can use the attacks of that Pokémon as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.) If that Pokémon is no longer your opponent's Active Pokémon, choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon for Ditto to copy.

data.name: Deoxys Speed Forme
data.flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Speed Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Speed Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys Speed Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Jirachi
data.flavorText: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.

attacks.name: One Desire
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Doom Desire
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Jirachi. The Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out at the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Forretress
data.flavorText: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.

abilities.name: Iron Shell
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to Forretress (excluding effects of attacks), you may flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding any Forretress).

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: Forretress does 40 damage to itself.

data.name: Groudon
data.flavorText: It had been asleep in underground magma ever since it fiercely fought Kyogre long ago.

attacks.name: Drought
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 basic Fighting Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Major Earthquake
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy attached to Groudon and this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Heatran
data.flavorText: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

abilities.name: Smelt
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Heatran. This power can't be used if Heatran is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Heavy Metal
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Metal Energy attached to Heatran. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Kyogre
data.flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

attacks.name: Drizzle
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: High Tide
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to Kyogre. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Lopunny
data.flavorText: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

abilities.name: Healing Tail
abilities.text: As long as Lopunny is your Active Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Mesprit
data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

abilities.name: Psychic Bind
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Mesprit from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Your opponent can't use any Poké-Powers on his or her Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

data.name: Regice
data.flavorText: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Regi Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Discard 2 cards from your hand and choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches that Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Regice is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Ice Reflect
attacks.text: If Regice was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Poliwrath
data.flavorText: With extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

attacks.name: Focus Punch
attacks.text: If Poliwrath was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Regigigas
data.flavorText: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

abilities.name: Recover Mechanism
abilities.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to Regigigas, remove all Special Conditions from Regigigas.

attacks.name: Gigaton Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Regirock
data.flavorText: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.

abilities.name: Regi Cycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a Fighting Energy card in your discard pile, you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to Regirock. This power can't be used if Regirock is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Torkoal
data.flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

abilities.name: White Smoke
abilities.text: As long as Torkoal is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects, including damage, done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Black Soot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Paralyzed.

data.name: Registeel
data.flavorText: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.

abilities.name: Regi Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, remove 3 damage counters from Registeel. This power can't be used if Registeel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rotating Claws
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Registeel. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Registeel.

data.name: Shedinja
data.flavorText: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one's spirit.

abilities.name: Resent
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Shedinja would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon and each of the opponent's Pokémon that has the same name as the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Curse and Deceive
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If Shedinja has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Unown !
data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown ! from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Unown ! does 10 damage to itself, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Victreebel
data.flavorText: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.

attacks.name: Burning Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned. Before applying these effects, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Energy Dissolve
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Uxie
data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Knowledge." It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

abilities.name: Set Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Uxie from your hand onto your Bench, you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic Restore
attacks.text: You may put Uxie and all cards attached to it on the bottom of your deck in any order.

data.name: Castform Rain Form
data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Rain Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Rain Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform Rain Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Castform
data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Castform on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Weather Ball
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, remove 3 damage counters from Castform. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Castform Snow-Cloud Form
data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Snow-cloud Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Snow-cloud Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform Snow-cloud Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Vileplume
data.flavorText: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

abilities.name: Energy Reaction
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Grass or Psychic Energy card from your hand to Vileplume (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), you may use this power. If you attach a Grass Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If you attach a Psychic Energy card, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Disturbing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Camerupt
data.flavorText: It has volcanoes on its back. If magma builds up in its body, it shudders, then erupts violently.

attacks.name: Eruption
attacks.text: Each player discards the top of his or her deck. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Camerupt does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Anorith
data.flavorText: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Anorith by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Castform Sunny Form
data.flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Sunny Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Sunny Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform Sunny Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Castform Sunny Form.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: It's drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Drifblim by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Exeggutor
data.flavorText: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Psychic Strategy
attacks.text: Each player counts the number of cards in his or her opponent's hand. Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a number of cards up to the number of cards his or her opponent had. (You draw your cards first.)

attacks.name: Super Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Discard as many Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokémon. For each Energy card you discarded, flip a coin. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Gliscor
data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sharp Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Grumpig
data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psycho-power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

attacks.name: Magical Step
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused. Put 6 damage counters instead of 3 on the Confused Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Grumpig.

data.name: Houndoom
data.flavorText: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.

abilities.name: Revenge Fang
abilities.text: If you have less Benched Pokémon than your opponent, each of Houndoom's attacks does 40 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Burning Sensation
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Houndoom.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."

attacks.name: Rushing Water
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."

attacks.name: Energy Split
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Bolt
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn.

data.name: Ledian
data.flavorText: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Baton Pass
attacks.text: You may switch Ledian with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Ledian as you like to the new Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lucario
data.flavorText: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.

attacks.name: Focus Blast
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Spike Lariat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Marowak
data.flavorText: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

attacks.name: Heavy Bone
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Marowak can't use Heavy Bone during your next turn.

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won't be scratched if it collides with a jet.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Metang during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunderous Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxio.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won't be scratched if it collides with a jet.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Ninjask
data.flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

abilities.name: Cast-off Shell
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ninjask from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon and if your Bench isn't full, you may put Shedinja onto your Bench as a Basic Pokémon from your hand or your discard pile.

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

data.name: Mightyena
data.flavorText: It chases down prey in a pack. It will never disobey the commands of a skilled Trainer.

attacks.name: Bite On
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't an Evolved Pokémon, that Pokémon can't attack, retreat, or use any Poké-Powers during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Harass
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon you have in play.

data.name: Persian
data.flavorText: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Piloswine
data.flavorText: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.

attacks.name: Charge Dash
attacks.text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Piloswine does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.

attacks.name: Aqua Pump
attacks.text: You may discard up to 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Starmie
data.flavorText: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

attacks.name: Star Boomerang
attacks.text: You may return Starmie and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Core Flash
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Swalot
data.flavorText: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Swalot. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Swalot's, this attack does 80 damage instead.

attacks.name: Gunk Shot
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Swellow
data.flavorText: It circles the sky in search of prey. When it spots one, it dive steeply to catch the prey.

abilities.name: Big Wing
abilities.text: If Swellow has no Energy attached to it, Swellow's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Mach Descent
attacks.text: If Swellow was on your Bench this turn, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

data.name: Tauros
data.flavorText: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.

attacks.name: Herd Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Tauros you have in play. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, Tauros does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.flavorText: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.

attacks.name: Tentacle Strike
attacks.text: Search your opponent's discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to any of your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. For each Energy card attached in this way, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dangerous Poison
attacks.text: If Tentacruel has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Unown J
data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: JUNK
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown J from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Remove the Special Condition Asleep from the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Unown U
data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: UNSEEN
abilities.text: As long as Unown U is on your Bench, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done by your opponent's Pokémon to any Unown on your Bench.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card and discard it. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Unown V
data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: VACATION
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 2 damage counters from each of your Pokémon. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Unown V is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Unown R
data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: RETIRE
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if Unown R is on your Bench, you may discard Unown R and all cards attached to it. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Then, draw a card.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Unown W
data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: WALL
abilities.text: As long as Unown W is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Unown Y
data.flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.name: YAWN
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown Y is on your Bench, you may remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Active Unown and that Unown is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Unown ?
data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown ? is on your Bench, you may choose a Pokémon in your hand and put it face down. Your opponent guesses a type of that Pokémon. Reveal that card. If your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card. Then, put that card back into your hand.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw a card.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

abilities.name: Metal Chain
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to Beldum (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), you may search your deck for Beldum and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beldum is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Beldum does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

attacks.name: Allure
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Bellsprout
data.flavorText: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

attacks.name: Vine Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Careless Tackle
attacks.text: Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

attacks.name: Aqua Spark
attacks.text: If Chinchou has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Buneary
data.flavorText: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Buneary. Buneary is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Corphish
data.flavorText: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

data.name: Cubone
data.flavorText: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Grass Basic Pokémon and Psychic Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Frustration
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Gligar
data.flavorText: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey's face.

attacks.name: Light Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Gligar
data.flavorText: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey's face.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

attacks.name: Space Out
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Gloom. Gloom is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Stinky Nectar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Gulpin
data.flavorText: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Gastro Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Reverse Thrust
attacks.text: Switch Horsea with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hitmontop
data.flavorText: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by ten.

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Gut Spin
attacks.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmontop, you may switch Hitmontop with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: It conveys its feelings using different cries. It works in a pack to cleverly take down prey.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

attacks.name: Counter Punch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Hitmonchan is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gut Strike
attacks.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmonchan, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.

attacks.name: Gut Kick
attacks.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmonlee, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Ledyba
data.flavorText: It is so timid, it can't move if it isn't with a swarm of others. It conveys its feelings with scent.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Ledyba does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Lileep
data.flavorText: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lileep.

data.name: Meowth
data.flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Nincada
data.flavorText: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.

attacks.name: Show Off
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Nosepass
data.flavorText: Its nose is a magnet. As a result, this Pokémon always keeps its face pointing north.

attacks.name: Nose Poke
attacks.text: If Probopass is on your Bench, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Numel
data.flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Oddish.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Poliwag
data.flavorText: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.

attacks.name: Twiddle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Pineco does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Poliwhirl
data.flavorText: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Poochyena
data.flavorText: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

attacks.name: Recharge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card attach it to Shinx. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Skitty
data.flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

attacks.name: Rob
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Pokémon Tool or Technical Machine cards in his or her hand, put those cards on top of his or her deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

data.name: Spoink
data.flavorText: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Swinub
data.flavorText: It loves eating mushrooms that grow under dead grass. It also finds hot springs while foraging.

attacks.name: Sniff Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Staryu
data.flavorText: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Staryu and remove 3 damage counters from Staryu.

data.name: Taillow
data.flavorText: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Taillow's Peck attack's base damage is 30.

data.name: Tentacool
data.flavorText: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.

attacks.name: Crystal Barrier
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tentacool during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Mysterious Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Tyrogue
data.flavorText: It is famous for its eagerness to fight and always nurses injuries from challenging larger foes.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan, or Hitmontop from your hand onto Tyrogue (this counts as evolving Tyrogue) and remove all damage counters from Tyrogue.

attacks.name: Gut Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and Tyrogue does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Weepinbell
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Yanma
data.flavorText: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: Switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Yanma during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Bubble Coat
rules: Attach Bubble Coat to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
As long as Bubble Coat is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon has no Weakness. If that Pokémon is damaged by an opponent's attack, discard this card at the end of the turn.

data.name: Snowpoint Temple
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +20 HP.

data.name: Cynthia's Feelings
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw 4 more cards.

data.name: Energy Pickup
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Buck's Training
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards. As long as Buck's Training is next to your Active Pokémon, each of your Active Pokémon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Poké Radar
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose as many Pokémon as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Azelf LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Azelf. Azelf LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Psychic Aura
abilities.text: Each of your Psychic Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Deep Balance
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Gliscor LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Gliscor. Gliscor LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Shoot Poison
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Gliscor LV.X from your hand onto your Active Gliscor, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Night Slash
attacks.text: You may switch Gliscor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Root Fossil
rules: Play Root Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Root Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Root Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Root Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Root Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Spongy Stone
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

data.name: Magnezone LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Magnezone. Magnezone LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Electric Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Lightning or Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Cyber Shock
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy and a Metal Energy attached to Magnezone. The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Rhyperior LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Rhyperior. Rhyperior LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Hard Crush
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 50 damage for each Energy card you discarded.

attacks.name: Upthrow
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for all Fighting Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

data.name: Stark Mountain
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Once during each player's turn, that player may choose a Fire or Fighting Energy attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon and move that Energy to 1 of his or her Pokémon.

data.name: Uxie LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Uxie. Uxie LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Trade Off
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck. This power can't be used if Uxie is affected by a Special Condition. You can't use more than 1 Trade Off Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Zen Blade
attacks.text: Uxie can't use Zen Blade during your next turn.

data.name: Mesprit LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Mesprit. Mesprit LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Healing Look
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supreme Blast
attacks.text: If don't have Uxie LV.X and Azelf LV.X in play, this attack does nothing. Discard all Energy attached to Mesprit.

data.name: Technical Machine TS-1
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own.

attacks.name: Evoluter
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Technical Machine TS-2
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own.

attacks.name: Devoluter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X). Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon and put that card back into your opponent's hand.

data.name: Claw Fossil
rules: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Claw Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Claw Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Claw Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Jagged Stone
abilities.text: If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Mewtwo LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Mewtwo. Mewtwo LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Psybarrier
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo by your opponent's Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Burn
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Mewtwo.
